ratings.comment: Absolutely no outlines given in lectures. Sometimes he types vocab and projects in but other than that you are listening to a professor spout off on tangents and waste your time. Oh and there are two exams and participation... THAT'S IT.  So, if you are not a test taker, do not take this class.  Also, absolutely no way to make up missing points.

Downs is great! Definitely the best professor I've ever had. He explains everything so well -you never leave confused. He's very interesting and engaging, and very funny! Interesting class. It is not easy but it's very fair and so interesting it doesn't even matter. Definitely taking a class with him again
Great guy. So engaging. Hilarious. Brings in real world examples with a touch of pop culture. Top 3 prof all time!

Downs is simply one of the best. He cares deeply about truly educating his students and is willing to talk about anything during office hours. His lectures are fast-paced and engaging. He will challenge you to defend and possibly reassess your beliefs and question the status quo. If you're willing to work hard and think deeply, you'll love Downs!

Downs is the best professor I have ever had at UW. The man is a genius. The class is awesome and Downs is hilarious so going to lecture is actually enjoyable. He may be a little full of himself, but he kind of has a right to because he is so awesome.
Selfish, arrogant and rude. He rudely told me to go away when I went to introduce myself.  What do you expect from a person who builds his ego from books nobody reads?

Downs will make you think harder than almost any other professor at UW. Class is always interesting, but varies from well-structured to extremely unorganized. Lectures on assigned cases and then prompts discussion. Downs is an absolute expert but sometimes fails to convey the information in a concise manner. Will definitely open your eyes.

One of the best professors at UW. You'll think more in his class than any other class and take a lot away from it. His lectures aren't very organized but a lot is discussion in lecture. He is awesome, hilarious, and laid back. 2 exams and a final, they aren't easy but not impossible and they're curved. One of my favorite classes I've ever taken!!!!

You will learn more from Downs' classes than you will from any other professor. It's not easy and you will have to put in extra time, but it will be worth it. If you go into talk to him, he is helpful if he can tell you've made an effort. His helpfulness and approachability has nothing to do with whether or not you're a hot girl.

I guess I don't get it. This guy gets pretty good ratings on here but not from me. The lectures are hard to follow with his constant tangents about the raiders and about how awesome he is. The class should be called Downs' contributions to the first amendment. As for the material, this is a difficult class. Three hard exams (two essay/id, one mc).

Downs is a brilliant man & a riot. His intelligence, passion about what he teaches, and goofy personality keeps you engaged all semester. Definitely one of my favorite courses (1st amendment). Go to lecture, discussion definitely, and independently find the significance of the cases & you'll do just fine. LOVE DOWNS!

He has a great reputation at UW-Madison, and deserves so. This class was by no means easy, and hard to really know how to study for it. But he is a very good lecturer and will keep you engaged. I regretted taking it just b/c it wasn't as interesting as I hoped and more difficult than I planned. Neither are Downs' fault, however.

Great Professor. He is very interesting. Probably the best professor I have had at UW-Madison. He is really funny, a little ADD at times but all around great. You get to drop one test so that worked out great. Got an A in the class pretty easily.
Downs is awesome. By far one of my favorite professors. He's hilarious, very easy-going and encourages discussion. Coursework isn't difficult as long as you attend lecture and do the readings.
Downs is funny and awesome. Most enjoyable lectures ever. He gets to the point and teaches well, but likes to have some fun along the way. Great Professor! very interesting to listen to

Go to lecture and take some notes.  He's hilarious, intelligent, and passionate, making his lectures enjoyable.  The exams are difficult but completely fair.  He made the final optional for us... :)  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

The person who called Downs unorganized must be a freshman who likes notes written on the board high school style. Downs is an amazing professor & his lectures are phenomenal and thought provoking. Likes telling funny/interesting/relevant stories. 470 is the best class I have taken at Madison b/c of him. Made me reevaluate my stance on many issues.

idk what the last guy is talking about, yeah the lectures weren't organized in any strict manner, but i found that interesting and refreshing...downs encourages a lot of discussion, which keeps it fresh...i only read one of the paperbacks and very few of the cases in the book (just look em up on the internet) and i got an AB---sweet class

He's hysterical. Most of lecture is discussion amongst the class. This won't help you on the exams, but it's interesting. Exams are pretty difficult-you'll need to put in some real effort if you want to do well. Do the readings (including the novels) and take notes on each case-they'll plus your lecture notes will be very useful for the 3 exams.

Very overrated.  Horribly disorganized, terrible lecturer.  Hard to follow and full of himself to boot.  You can do we'll in this class, but it requires a ton of independent work.  I would look elsewhere to find more interesting and easier classes
Prof Downs is a great professor. PS452 was probably my favorite class at UW.  I highly recommend taking a class with Downs

I had Downs for 470 and 695.  Absolutely amazing.  He is intelligent, realistic, logical, and thoughtful.  He holds strong convictions, but is amazingly open to changing his stance on something if you give him a reasoned argument.  Prepare well for the exams - the 470 exams are difficult.  If you take 695, get ready for an awesome mock trial.

Great professor! He is engaging, interesting, and encourages participation. He is also probably one of the most intelligent professors I have ever had. He is hilarious, which makes a power lecture seem to fly by. Not too hard if you study. I did not read the cases, as he briefed the important ones in class. Take a class with him, it is so worth it!

Awesome class: mix of criminal law, philosophy, history, psychology, and sports. Brings up a lot of great issues and really makes you think. It was one of the only power lectures I've ever enjoyed here at Madison. Plus Downs is awesome. Likes participation and connects with his students. MTs are tough but fair- usually a generous curve is applied.

Downs is the best professor I have ever had.  He's hilarious, engaging, incredibly intelligent, and i actually look forward to going to lecture. Exams ask a lot of you but as long as you prepare it's easy to do well. Take a class with him!
Best, most engaging professor ever. I remembered why I loved this major. He is inspired and accessible.

Great prof! Funny and very smart. An A is definitely possible, but not "easy." If you are thinking about law school, think seriously about taking a class with Downs. You will learn to read and brief cases. Lectures are stimulating, not boring.

Awesome class and awesome professor. Downs is hilarious and makes every class interesting. The material itself is not very difficult, just need preparation and time to study to do well on the test, which are not very hard.

Easy enough class, in class exams have big curves, first exam was take-home, second was multiple choice, final is open notes. Downs is full of himself, makes a big deal about all of the people he knows(and he never lets you forget how well connected he is)and gets a bit old.  Not a hard class at all. Overall experience was mediocre.

Disclosure: I studied with Prof. Downs YEARS ago. BUT - He was easily one of the best educators I've ever been privileged to know. Outside of 2 classes with him, I had little interest in the others he taught during my 4 yrs, but I took EVERY one. He was THAT good. If YOU take yourself too seriously you won't 'get' him. So don't.

Professor Downs dropped a bomb yesterday: "The final is optional."  How cool is that?  Seriously, he's a reknowned scholar, a great professor, and a lot of fun.  If you're serious about Law School, take a class or five with Downs...

Downs is an enthusiastic professor.  He makes lecture interesting and is always available to answer questions.  My TA tried to scare us into thinking the class was going to ruin our GPA.  If you go to lecture, discussion, and brief the cases, you will be fine.
Downs is a great & tries to keep you interested.  Entertaining lectures.  Tests are difficult.  Not necessary to read the cases if you go to class and discussion.  Also, hope for a good TA.
I highly recommend taking a class with Downs.  He is a brilliant guy and a great overall teacher.

Good class, I went to office hours to get the clarity I missed in lecture.  My TA also did a great job on clarification.  The problem with lecture is that sometimes Downs gets bored with a subject and moves on with quite poor transitions.  But, if you pay attention it is never that bad.
great teacher.

Completely full of himself and uninterested in doing anything except flirting with girls in the front row. Very intelligent and knows the material in and out, but he acts like he can't be bothered with anything you ask him (unless you happen to be hot and female).

Funny guy, yes, but I personally found Downs rather pretentious.  He was my "TA" in the honors section, and could hardly give people the time of day - never answered emails.  Interesting class and material, but he is not very helpful, and lectures are somewhat disorganized.  apparently if you have a real TA it's much easier.

This is a great class. Downs is a genius but he's not full of himself at all. TA's are a bit uninformed. If you do the reading and come to class you will get an A or a B. Briefing cases isn't necessary - he goes over what he wants you to know in class. just read them.

Downs is a great professor. He lays his political cards on the table, yet is completely open and receptive to other peoples' opinions. Definitely the least "dismissive" professor I've had so far. Just remember: if you raise your hand and there's something on your shirt, he'll ask about it.

Downs is entertaining, but his exams are hopelessly unreasonable.  The pointless multiple choice exam in this class was like a game of Trivial Pursuit.  Downs obviously knows his stuff, but I didn't think that he taught it very well.
No Comments

Hands down the best prof I've had here. He definately knows what he's talking about and he's really good at explaining it. His exams were challenging but very fair and I actually looked forward to going to lecture. He's hilarious and really makes you think! Take this class!
Yeah, he's funny, but his lectures were totally pointless. Exams were unreasonably difficult. Not to mention, his TAs were completely uninformed and useless.
Never a dull class with this professor.  You'll learn as much sports trivia as you do about the law.  No topic is taboo and his sense of humor is infectious.

Downs makes class enjoyable more than any professor I have ever had.  He understands that while the material he is covering is important, that it is not all there is.  As he puts it, my priorities are family, country, and raider football.  Take his class, you won't regret it.
Downs really has a great sense of humor.  He knows his stuff well, and if you need any help in class, he is more than willing to make time for you.  Definately my favorite professor at Madison.
Fabulous teacher. He is funny, intelligent and really knows his material. By far the best teacher i have had at madison
No Comments
Incorporates humor very well and appropriately in his teaching.  If you like Bruce Springsteen, take a class with him - he likes to use The Boss in anecdotes in lecture and on exams.
Professor Downs is extremely intelligent and treats his student with respect, it is an honor to sit in his class.
